Package org.openlca.core.matrix.solvers

Interface Factorization

All Known Implementing Classes:
DenseFactorization, SparseFactorization
public interface Factorization
Stores the factorization of a square matrix `A` (e.g. a LU decomposition) which can be efficiently used to calculate the `x` of an equation `A * b = x` for a given `b`.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    dispose()
    Disposes the factorization (e.g.
    boolean
    isDisposed()
    Returns true if this factorization is disposed.
    int
    size()
    Returns the number of rows which must be equal to the number of columns of the underlying matrix `A`.
    double[]
    solve​(double[] b)
    Calculates the `x` in `A * x = b` for the given `b`.
    default double[]
    solve​(int i, double val)
    By default creates a vector `b` with `b[i] = val` and calls `solve(b)` on this factorization.
    default Matrix
    solve​(Matrix b)
    Calculates the `X` in `A * X = B` for the given matrix `B`.

  • Method Details

    • size

      int size()
      Returns the number of rows which must be equal to the number of columns of the underlying matrix `A`.

    • solve

      default double[] solve​(int i, double val)
      By default creates a vector `b` with `b[i] = val` and calls `solve(b)` on this factorization. Implementers should override this method when they have a more efficient method available for this.

    • solve

      double[] solve​(double[] b)
      Calculates the `x` in `A * x = b` for the given `b`.

    • solve

      default Matrix solve​(Matrix b)
      Calculates the `X` in `A * X = B` for the given matrix `B`. By default this calculates `X[:,j]` for each column `j` of `B[:,j]` separately. Implementers should overwrite this method if they have a more efficient method available.

    • dispose

      void dispose()
      Disposes the factorization (e.g. clears native memory etc.).

    • isDisposed

      boolean isDisposed()
      Returns true if this factorization is disposed.
